subject: Philosophy
title: Moral Realism
description: Learn Moral Realism in one minute.

hook.text: Torturing children for fun is wrong â€” not just in your culture, but everywhere, always.

buildup.text: Moral realists say some moral facts exist independently of what anyone thinks or feels.

discovery.text: Just as gravity exists whether you believe in it or not, cruelty is wrong whether a culture accepts it.

twist.text: The hard part is proving it. You can measure gravity. How do you measure a moral fact?

climax.text: Moral realism feels intuitively right but remains philosophically difficult to defend completely.

punchline.text: Some things feel universally wrong. Proving why is harder.

quiz.question: What do moral realists believe?
options: Some moral truths exist independently of opinion
Only science can determine right and wrong
